title: "Premiata Fabbrica Macchine" squarish sans caps w/ nice "M" shape
content:
Can anyone name this typeface? It has a nice “M” shape. Any thoughts?

 [‹ (x) The Art of Dragon Magazine nameplate blackletter - ITC Honda {Jan E}](http://web.archive.org/web/20081011042436/http:/www.typophile.com/node/36143 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Classic postcard chunky font - hand lettered {Patricia} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081011042436/http:/www.typophile.com/node/36133 "Go to next forum topic")
author: baskervillebold

comments.content:
Lets try that again...it’s late and I’m tired.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20081011042436im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/FONT01_5223.jpg)

Where does this sample come from? Is it inscribed on a machine? Printed on paper?

[House Gothic 23](http://web.archive.org/web/20081011042436/http:/www.houseind.com/index.php?page=showfont&id=15) is equally supercurve-ish, but hasn’t got that typical M shape.
It came from a printed paper poster. The type is distressed so it’s a little difficult to see the details well.
